sen.j: 島田 五空（しまだ ごくう、1875年(明治8年)-1928年（昭和3年)）は俳人。
sen.e: Goku Shimada (born 1875; died 1928) was a haiku poet.
Goku Shimada (1875 - 1928) was a haiku poet.
sen.cmt: 括弧内のborn, diedを削除しました。
sen.e: Goku Shimada (1875 - 1928) was a haiku poet.

sen.cmt: This is not a sentence. What does it mean?
sen.e: His real name was Toyosaburo.
sen.cmt: 豊三郎は本名です。講談社デジタル版日本人名大辞典+Plusで確認しました。原文に「本名は」と追加しておりませんのでご確認ください。
sen.e: His real name was Toyosaburo.

sen.j: 能代市の文化活動にふかく貢献した人物である。
sen.e: His is an individual who contributed greatly to the cultural activities of Noshiro City.
His was an individual who greatly contributed to the cultural activities of Noshiro City.
sen.cmt: be動詞をwasと過去形に訂正し、greatlyの位置を変更しました。
sen.e: His was an individual who greatly contributed to the cultural activities of Noshiro City.

sen.j: 佐々木北涯、石井露月に指導される。
sen.e: He was taught by ??? and ???
He was taught by Hokugai SASAKI and Rogetsu ISHII.
sen.cmt: 人名は、講談社デジタル版日本人名大辞典+Plusで調べました。
sen.e: He was taught by Hokugai SASAKI and Rogetsu ISHII.

sen.j: 明治33年（1900年）、俳誌『俳星』を創刊した。
sen.e: He first published the haiku journal "???" in 1900.
sen.cmt: no term search for the name… don't know the reading…
sen.e: He first published the haiku journal "Haisei" in 1900.
He first published the haiku journal "Haisei" in 1900.

sen.j: ちなみに『俳星』とは、正岡子規の命名である。
sen.e: Incidentally, ??? Was the name of Shiki MASAOKA.
Incidentally, "Haisei" was named by Shiki MASAOKA.
sen.cmt: 命名の意味の取り違えと思われるので訂正しました。
sen.e: Incidentally, "Haisei" was named by Shiki MASAOKA.

sen.j: また、新聞にも手を出し、『能代新報』を刊行した。
sen.e: In addition, he published a newspaper called the "Noshiro City Times".
In addition, he published a newspaper called the "Noshiro Shinpo".
sen.cmt: 新聞名はそのままローマ字表記にしました。
sen.e: In addition, he published a newspaper called the "Noshiro Shinpo".

sen.j: 弟子に安成二郎がいる。
sen.e: His disciples include Jiro YASUNARI.
His disciples include Jiro YASUNARI.
His disciples include Jiro YASUNARI.

sen.j: 能代市柳町にある八幡神社と中川原の稲荷社に句碑がある。
sen.e: There are stanes with his haiku inscribed on them at the Hachiman-jinja Shrine in Yanagi-cho, and at the Inari-jinja Shrine in Nakagawara-cho, Noshiro City.
sen.cmt: The terms column is insufficient in information as the Japanese text is unclear. The search database gives on Nakagawa-cho, and I assume that the stones are in Shrines in different disctricts of the same city.
sen.e: There are stones with his haiku inscribed on them at the Hachiman-jinja Shrine in Yanagi-cho, and at the Inari-jinja Shrine in Nakagawara-cho, Noshiro City.
sen.cmt: stonesの誤字を訂正しました。
sen.e: There are stones with his haiku inscribed on them at the Hachiman-jinja Shrine in Yanagi-cho, and at the Inari-jinja Shrine in Nakagawara-cho, Noshiro City.
